ygData.subject: Cantera 1.5.4 released (unix/linux/Mac source code)
ygData.msgSnippet: Cantera 1.5.4 has just been released,  You can get it from the sourceforge site as a tar.gz file.  I will try to get a binary Windows installer made tomorrow.

From: David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...>
Subject: Cantera 1.5.4 released (unix/linux/Mac source code)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=44728387
X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

Cantera 1.5.4 has just been released,  You can get it from the 
sourceforge site as a tar.gz file.  I will try to get a binary Windows 
installer made tomorrow.

New features:

- new ReactorNet class allows simulating multiple highly coupled 
reactors fully implicitly

- accurate liquid/vapor equations of state for water, nitrogen, 
methane, oxygen, hydrogen.  See Python and Matlab demos rankine.py and 
rankine.m, respectively, for an example of how to work with these.  Now 
it is possible to carry out vapor power cycle and combined cycle 
simulations with Cantera.

- most bugs identified by users have been fixed.

- new Matlab and Python demo scripts.

- new tutorials.

Everything builds cleanly on linux, and all Python and Matlab demos run 
without problem. Same is true on Mac OS X.

If you encounter any problem building this, let me know so I can fix 
the problem quickly.

I am working on a document describing how to do reactor simulations 
with Cantera 1.5.4.  It may be ready in a week or so.  In the meantime, 
look at the demo scripts and programs.
